imdb_user_reviews.contents: Lazy, cynical, and mean-spirited - the end could've come sooner
A lazy milking of the cash cow.
A limp, unimaginative, charmless, joke-free action movie, pretending it's a comedy, and one that should be shunted and long forgotten
The Final Episode of a Historic Trilogy
Trilogy?!?....just simply turning a quick buck. A con-movie.
Don't listen to anyone, watch it for yourself! :D
A fitting candidate for the sewers of Bangkok
Where the comedy fails, the action will keep you entertained
Not as bad as most think.
Well worth it for a good laugh
Too much Chow kills this cash cow.
"It's one of the worst movies to end a film series just like The Matrix Revolutions!"
Do Not Listen To All these Negative Reviews!!
Hangover III wraps things up quite nicely
Zach is super annoying, not as funny, but it has heart
Do you even know, what's going on? Yes, I do. Phil's doing all the work, I'm his assistant and you are standing there looking like an idiot!
Better than the second, but that's not saying much. I hope this is the end for the series
Better than the second, not as good as the first.
Todd Phillips owes me a refund!!!!
No hangover, no laughs, no point.
Worse than crap. Not funny. Offensive. Waste of time and money.
This movie suffered from a Hangover
Hangover 3 - Good but not the best
An inconsequential end to a deteriorating franchise
Worth the laugh! No idea why everyone is so Nancy about it!
Deranged Alan steals the movie with disastrous results

when do you decide to cut the Sh#t off?

The Hangover Part III is so bad?
The franchise is suffering from a bad hangover...
This is a fine ending to the series
Unfunny second sequel brings its trilogy to a disappointing conclusion
If this is the final chapter for the Wolfpack, it's a sad and unfortunate way to go out  not with a bang, but with a whimper and a slap in the face.
If you ever want a blue print for killing off a series

Not a bad hangover to wake up to
Good, but didn't live up to expectations set by the first two
Quite a bit different from its predecessors, and that's not a bad thing.

Befitting Finale to the trendsetter theme
Time to sober up, for this film is no longer a hangover.
Bits and pieces glued together, but it works well enough
The Third Installment Comes In Third.
0/10 Hoped this would make up for H2
What was the actual point in this film?
Did We Need Part III? Yes. Did We Need This Plot? No.
Great conclusion, not its full potential
When it's funny, it's hilarious. When it's lame, it's painful.
A pointless film with an astoundingly shallow plot, whose sole purpose is to be as nasty as possible in an attempt to humour us. The result - we rarely rejoice this Hangover.
Less witty than I and II, but not a flop
Not too bad, but wait until it come's out on DVD.
This movie should not have been made, very disappointing
Go out with a bang you say? They Did!

Glad I got to see this film in the cinema

Good story but lacked comedy, overall very poor!!!
A sour end to the trilogy.
I lost 100 minutes of my life.
Too much of anything makes you feel sick
Nowhere near as funny as it should to be
Time to reason with your man
The Hangover Part 3 is an adequate comedy.
In honor of our recent loss Ray Manzarek, "This is the end..."
A lot of dry humor, huge focus on Alan and Mr. Chow
Not too bad but interesting concept
Galifianakis saves this film from being a complete disaster

I'm so glad it is over...
It was not great....but a good ending.

Funny and better than I expected

different, but not all that bad.

Unlike the 2nd one this is funny and different. A good conclusion to the trilogy. Even if you didn't like #2 watch this. I say B+
worth watching, if u liked the others

Not as bad as some people are saying.
Hilarious! Not as good and original as the 1st one but a good sequel
Hilarious sad to see it end

I had high hopes...definitely time to say farewell.
